data.prayer: Father, you have chosen the weak things of this world to confound the strong. Make the poor and outcast in the state of Guelma a testimony of your strength.
data.verse: God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise. God chose the weak things of the world, that he might put to shame the things that are strong;

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Guelma, Algeria
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: God, we pray for the believers in Guelma, Algeria to be generous so that they would be worthy of greater investment by you.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 1464 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Guelma, Algeria to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Father, knowing that teachers will be judged more strictly, help the local leaders in Guelma, Algeria to be careful with their words.
data.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers, for you know that we who teach will be judged with greater strictness.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Bedouin, Nail people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Father, for all those you call to look after your flock from the 82 believers in Guelma, please, make them passionate about hearing your Word.
data.verse: Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Guelma.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Spirit, make the Word of God a delight to the people of Guelma, like it was to David.
data.verse: I delight in your decrees; I will not neglect your Word.
